cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Book of the Dead is meant to help the deceased person navigate the afterlife.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (typically a text, object, or practice) is employed with the functional purpose of benefiting or enabling the object (a person, state, or outcome).
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Practices and Burials
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: UsageContext: funerary ritual and post-mortem journey

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Book of the Dead is intended to help the deceased reach the realm of the gods.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (typically a text, object, or practice) is employed with the functional purpose of benefiting or enabling the object (a person, state, or outcome).

cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Religious texts are also meant to support the deceased's eternal existence in the realm of the gods.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject practice, object, or action is intended or used to achieve the object as its purpose or goal.
cluster_relations.subject_entity_name: religious texts in ancient Egyptian burials
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: eternal existence in the realm of the gods

cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (typically a text, object, practice, or action) is intended or employed to achieve the object as its purpose, function, or goal.
args.justification: All three relations describe a functional or intended purpose of funerary texts in relation to outcomes for the deceased or their afterlife state. They are semantically equivalent purpose/usage predicates, so they should share a single normalized canonical predicate 'has_purpose' and a unified description. The existing rel_cls and rel_cls_group already correctly capture a functional purpose usage relation, so they are retained.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (typically a text, object, practice, or action) is intended or employed to achieve the object as its purpose, function, or goal.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations describe a functional or intended purpose of funerary texts in relation to outcomes for the deceased or their afterlife state. They are semantically equivalent purpose/usage predicates, so they should share a single normalized canonical predicate 'has_purpose' and a unified description. The existing rel_cls and rel_cls_group already correctly capture a functional purpose usage relation, so they are retained.
